subject: Re: [junit] SimpleTestCollector.isTestClass
msgSnippet: Dirk, I m sorry not to have responded sooner.  Are you sure this is a bug? The method is taking in the filename of a class, not a method. David Saff
messageBody:
Dirk,

I'm sorry not to have responded sooner. Are you sure this is a bug?
The method is taking in the filename of a class, not a method.

David Saff

duit1998 wrote:
> The method SimpleTestCollector.isTestClass(String classFileName) is
> implemented faulty:
>
> This is the implementation of junit 3.8.1:
> protected boolean isTestClass(String classFileName) {
> return
> classFileName.endsWith(".class") &&
> classFileName.indexOf('$') < 0 &&
> classFileName.indexOf("Test") > 0;
> }
>
> Using this implementation a test method will not be recognized if it
> starts with the term "test" (any case) becaus String.indexOf returns
> -1 if no substring "test" could be found. If the method name starts
> with "test" String.indexOf returns 0. However, the implementation
> quoted above returns FALSE although the substring "test" could be
> found!. Thus, we have to change the last LOC to test fpr >= 0:
>
> classFileName.indexOf("Test") > 0;
>
> Now it works.
>
> Where is the place to post this so that this bug will be cleared?
> (...though I could not believe to be the first to find out about this.)
>
> Dirk
